Film Reviews

London Film Festival 2018: Happy New Year, Colin Burstead

By Andrew Young

Andrew Young is full of praise for Ben Wheatley's latest film, which received its world premiere at this year's LFF

Review: Venom

Thomas Ron looks at the latest comic book offering and is less than pleased with the result

TV Review: Agents of Shield Season 5

Thomas Ron looks at the latest season of the Marvel spin-off TV show

Review: American Animals

Raquel Bartra argues that this true story is better and stranger than fiction.

Review: BlacKkKlansman

Jasmine Onstad is won over by Spike Lee's latest film about an African-American police officer infiltrating the KKK

Review: The Meg

Euan Brook wishes this giant shark film had more bite though it still offers some old fashioned B-movie charm

Retro Review: Maurice

Before Call Me By Your Name, James Ivory directed this landmark piece of LGBTQ cinema during the 80s

Review: Skyscraper

Dwayne Johnson's latest vehicle fails to pack a punch, writes Cameron Craig

Review: First Reformed

Dan Molloy is thoroughly impressed by this brilliantly written Paul Schrader thriller

Review: Yellow Submarine

Cameron Craig is amazed by this animated adventure classic.

Advance Review: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again

Chay Quinn is captivated by the toe-tapping return to the Greek Island, Kalokairi.

Review: Incredibles 2

Thomas Ron gets nostalgic watching the sequel that's just as super as the original.

Review: Leave No Trace

Andrew Young praises the impressive performances in Debra Granik's stunning latest production

Review: Ocean's 8

Lily Robertson is underwhelmed by the new all-female instalment to the Ocean's film series

Review: Hereditary

Cameron Craig is left disappointed by one of the most hyped horror films of the year

Sheff/Doc/Fest: Review - Laila at the Bridge

Andrew Young reports back from this year's Sheffield Documentary Festival with praise for this enlightening and inspiring film

Review: The Strangers: Prey at Night

Euan Brook finds some merit in the trashiness of this horror sequel

Review: Let the Sunshine In

Giulia De Vita is left unimpressed by Claire Denis' latest film, but still has plenty of praise for Juliette Binoche

Review: Avengers: Infinity War

Chay Quinn is left floored by the latest Marvel spectacular

Review: Mary and the Witch's Flower

Jasper Cunningham-Ward thinks this Studio Ponoc effort is a promising successor to the legendary Studio Ghibli

Review: A Quiet Place

Euan Brook finds John Krasinski's horror an enjoyable experience, but with wasted potential

Review: Isle of Dogs

Isle of Dogs is near faultless and one of Anderson's best films, writes Jessica Jenkinson

Something Different: Two Days, One Night

Andrew Young explains the draw of Belgian realist masters Jean-Pierre & Luc Dardenne

Leaving the neighbourhood: The wonder and adventure of Moonrise Kingdom

Martin Kirsch looks back at one of Wes Anderson's finest films, ahead of the release of a new whimsical world

A festival diary

James Wright shares his thoughts from his day exploring the Manchester International Film Festival 2018

Review: Black Panther

Jasmine Onstad is full of praise for the MCU's latest offering, and stresses its importance for POC representation in the cinema

Review: Lady Bird

Greta Gerwig's directorial debut is a great success, writes Edoardo Torraca

Review: The Shape of Water

Jasmine Onstad offers glowing praise for Guillermo Del Toro's latest

Your Valentine's Day film: When Harry Met Sally...

Martin Kirsch recommends a look at an enduring romantic classic

Review: The Post

Spielberg takes on freedom of the press in a terrific thriller writes Jessica Jenkinson
